intro: Mesosphaerum spinulosum, commonly known as the spiny mesosphaerum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, spiny leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in coastal and sandy habitats, often found in fynbos vegetation. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
